intro: Plectranthus adenophorus, commonly known as the woolly plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can be propagated through stem cuttings. Plectranthus adenophorus is also valued for its aromatic properties and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
